revised_title: Development and Structure of the Skull in Urodelous Amphibia
tldr: The author examines the structure and development of the skull in urodelous amphibia, specifically the Axolotl and Seironota, to understand the morphological changes and metamorphoses they undergo. The study provides insights into the relationships between the skull, vertebral column, visceral arches, and subcutaneous cartilages in these species, as well as their evolutionary connections to other vertebrates.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Vertebrate anatomy
